speaker: Niles
text: You try and try, but at some point you finally have to admit, as much as you care about each other, your relationship isn't working and hasn't been for some time. _The camera pans across to show Dr. Schachter, a couples therapist, sitting in an easy chair and taking notes._

speaker: Schachter
text: But you two wouldn't be sitting here with me if you didn't want to save this relationship.  Isn't that true?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'd be willing to try.  I can't speak for... _The camera pans across to reveal not Maris, but Frasier, sitting on an identical therapist's couch._

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't have to speak for me, Niles.  I'm perfectly capable of speaking for myself.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I know.  Caruso wasn't so in love with the sound of his own voice.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is _that_ supposed to mean?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you tell me, Enrico.  What do you think it means?

speaker: Frasier
text: I guess I can tell you...

speaker: Schachter
text: Gentlemen, gentlemen, please! [_they quiet down_] Now, are we agreed that we want to do something to fix this problem?

speaker: Frasier/Niles
text: ** Yeah.../Well, if it's fixable, I suppose...

speaker: Schachter
text: All right.  Why doesn't one of you tell me how this started?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it began with me.  Last week, I was at work doing my radio show.  I was on the air with a troubled young woman. She had just started telling me about a recurring dream she had since childhood. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Two - KACL Frasier flashes back to his show._

speaker: Jill
text: [_v.o_] Okay, I'm in my bedroom, I'd just gotten out of the bath tub to get dressed. When I opened the closet, all my clothes are gone. Suddenly, I hear the sound of footsteps on the drive outside. I turn and there is a little girl with her nose pressed up against the window.

speaker: Frasier
text: That is amazing!

speaker: Jill
text: [_v.o_] But her breath is clogging up the glass so that I can't make out her face.  Only, I'm sure she's come to tell me something important. _Roz tries to get Frasier's attention about the show coming to the close but he fails to notice her._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, a girl on the other side of a glass with an urgent message. _Roz now gets on the side and frantically bangs on the window telling him the time is up but he still doesn't realize._

speaker: Frasier
text: And for some reason you're unwilling or able to receive it.

speaker: Roz
text: [_switches on her microphone_] I'm sorry, Dr. Crane, I hate to interrupt, but you're all out of time for today.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.  Um, listen, Jill, I'm terribly sorry, but listen, [_Bulldog enters looking annoyed at his delay_] I'd like to continue talking to you when we're off the air, so please don't hang up.  In the meantime, listeners, I've enjoyed our time today.  Tune in again tomorrow when we'll be talking with...

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_into microphone_] Blah, blah, Frasier Crane Show, happy health, goodbye! _Bulldog presses the off-air button and pushes Frasier to the wall in his chair, yanking off his headphones as he does so.  Frasier walks out of the booth as Bulldog begins his show._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yo, Jill.  You a football fan?

speaker: Jill
text: [_v.o_] Not really.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Beat it! [_presses button_] All right, this is Bulldog, ready to go!  _Frasier enters Roz's booth where Bulldog's producer is working. Frasier chats to Roz who is sorting the carts._

speaker: Frasier
text: I hate this job.  Not only do I have to put up with that annoying little sweat-sock, but when a caller comes in who has a truly fascinating problem, I'm barely even able to scratch the surface.  It makes me want to run screaming back to private practice!

speaker: Roz
text: I can imagine how frustrated you must be.  This show's gotta be constraining for a man of your staggering intellect. [_gives him a smile of awe_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] Hold it, stop, wait a minute! _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene One(b) - Therapist's Office._

speaker: Niles
text: You expect us to believe that Roz actually used a phrase like "staggering intellect"?

speaker: Frasier
text: It was something like that.

speaker: Niles
text: So, she might have said your "boundless brilliance," or, say, "the Olympian reaches of your wisdom."

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, do shut up.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you shut up!  _They carry on arguing for a while.  FADE OUT  Scene One(c) - Therapist's Office. We go back to where we left off with Frasier and Niles arguing._

speaker: Schachter
text: Gentlemen, gentlemen!  It is not important exactly what was said.

speaker: Niles
text: No, what is important is that he assumes it revolves around him, when the truth is it started several days before that, with me. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Three - Niles's Office Flashback.  Niles is comforting an elderly patient, who is holding herself with both arms in fear._

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] I'd been having some trouble with the psychiatrist in the office next door.  His unconventional therapy had started to intrude upon my sessions.

speaker: Niles
text: [_going to patient_] Mrs. Kelly, the key here is that you trust me.  So long as you're in this office you have no reason to feel anything but safe.

speaker: Niles
text: Just, please, think of this as your refuge, your sanctuary.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not saying that being a sole survivor of a plane crash wasn't a traumatizing experience for you.  But, I can get you to a point where the memories no longer haunt you. _Now both the man and the woman scream together, reducing Mrs. Kelly to a nervous wreck.  Niles can do nothing but put his arm around her._

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] His primal scream madness was ruining my practice. I had to do something.  The opportunity presented itself that Friday. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment. Niles carries on with his narration over this scene: Niles is going to the bar for sherry as Daphne folds some clothes.  Martin is sat in his chair and Frasier is on the sofa._

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o_] I'd come to Frasier's for dinner.  I remember Daphne, my father's health care worker, was telling the most delightful story...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I know what you're going though, Dr. Crane, dealing with a noisy neighbour.  Have I ever mentioned that couple that lived next door to me in London?  A married couple, who made the most un-Godly racket - in bed!  The walls must have been like tissue paper because I'd hear the whole performance every night.  Finally, I decided the only to get them to stop was to let them hear what I'd been hearing.  So, one night, I moved near the wall and I started...  _Niles freezes with the sherry bottle poised over his glass as Daphne acts out her story with voice and actions.  Frasier and Martin, also shocked, turn to look at her._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_moaning_] Ooh, yes!  Ooh, oh don't stop -  [_gasping_] Ooh, that's the spot - [_screams_] Oh, do it again!  Oh, you are the beastmaster, aren't you?!  Oh, for heaven's sake, just take me, you devil-spawned sex monkey! [_tosses her head, flinging her hair wildly about_] YES, YES, YES, YES, YES! [_stops, normal again_] Problem solved.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, Daphne, I drifted.  Would you mind telling that story again?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] Hold it, stop! _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene One(d) - Therapist's Office. Frasier stops the flashback._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you know full well that Daphne merely told us that story, she did not act it out.

speaker: Niles
text: [_uncertain_] Didn't she?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  Just tell the story!

speaker: Niles
text: Fine.  It was a few hours later... _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Five(a) - Frasier's Apartment. The flashback takes us to a few hours later that night when Martin, Frasier and Niles sit down with cups._

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o_] We were having espresso, and, perhaps to counter-act the stimulative effect, Frasier was telling us about his day.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I can't stop thinking about my last caller today. Fascinating young woman who had a recurring dream.

speaker: Martin
text: You know who's a helluva dreamer?  Eddie.

speaker: Martin
text: One night I'd wake up, he's lying on my forehead, dead asleep, with a big clump of my hair in his mouth, growlin'!  Bet you'd love to analyze that little brain of his.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] Yes, that would be the jewel in the crown of my career! [_then:_] Still, thinking about this woman has started me longing for private practice.  I guess I just miss the chance to dig deep with my patients.

speaker: Niles
text: Have you considered seeing patients on the side?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, of course.  I've got a list of people who've expressed interest.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I have a proposition.  I mentioned that doctor in the office next door?  Well, his lease is up.  If you were interested in his office, as his landlord, I could tell him and his screaming meamies to hit the road!

speaker: Frasier
text: You?

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm-mmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I?

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm-mmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: Working side by side?

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm-mmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't mind telling you the prospect sounds... quite exciting!

speaker: Niles
text: [_excited_] We could consult on each other's patients.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_excited_] We could give seminars together.

speaker: Niles
text: Even therapy groups!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God, "Crane & Crane", I can see our logo already; a giant Crane hovering over a human head!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, why are you laughing?  Why is Dad laughing?

speaker: Martin
text: You two, you'll never learn.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, you think this is a bad idea?

speaker: Martin
text: The restaurant you bought together, that was a bad idea! The book you tried to write together,  that was a bad idea! But this.... [_thinks_] No, that restaurant was still the stupidest one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Two little mis-adventures and you doom us to failure.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, baloney, you've been like this since you were kids. You two can't work together.

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe Dad's right.  We're not ready for this, it could lead to conflict and tension.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] Hold it! _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene One(e) - Therapist's Office. Frasier breaks the scene._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, tell the truth!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, all right. _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene Five(b) - Frasier's Apartment. We cut back to just after Martin's speech._

speaker: Niles
text: Stop raining on our parade, Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: To "Crane & Crane"!  _The brother clink their espressos together.  End of Act One  Act Two_  **HMMM...** _Scene Six(a) - Niles's Office. Frasier narrates the story in flashback.  Niles is getting some coffee as Frasier enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] Well, our first day together began innocently enough...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_enters_] Good morning, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: And to you, Dr. Crane

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, why should we be so formal, there's nobody around.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a hi-five, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, oh, sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: Would you like a coffee?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, please. [_takes one as he inhales_] Oh, Niles, I can't tell you how much I've missed that.  The smell of the office place.  Freshly oiled leather couches, the pungent coffee, the aroma of an exotic luncheon special wafting up from the cafeteria below.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, that's the lab next door.  They lost power last night, some of their tissue samples turned.  By the way, I've put together some recent articles you may want to peruse just to get up to speed. [_shows him a select few_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Up to speed?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it has been a while since you've practised and we could all use a little brushing up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's very considerate of you.  Just put my homework assignment in my box there.

speaker: Niles
text: As you wish. _Niles puts the select articles in, then picks up a small pile of books from the desk and also puts them in the box.  Then he lifts a large stack of books from the floor and also puts them in the box.  Frasier is not amused.  Daphne enters, struggling with a large plant._

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, where shall we put this then?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the only place it should go, actually, is right here by the couch, I think.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, Daphne, here on the desk will pick up the earth tones in the carpet.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, there's this desk space here by the coffee station.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, underneath the heating vent?!  Why not just give it a blindfold and a cigarette!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's your office, put it where you like.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, it is your plant.

speaker: Daphne
text: And it's my bleedin' back, so I'm putting it right here!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_aside to Frasier_] Honestly, I don't know how you put up with him. [_exits_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o_] Liar!  Liar!  Daphne never said that! _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene One(f) - Therapist's Office. Niles brings the scene back._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, she said it with body language.

speaker: Niles
text: I happen to be fluent in that language and she said nothing of the kind!

speaker: Schachter
text: Will someone tell me what's so important about this plant?

speaker: Niles
text: You'll know soon enough.  I'm telling the rest of the story. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Six(b) - Niles's Practice. We flashback to Daphne still struggling with the plant._

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm putting it right here! _Daphne puts the plant down on the coffee table and exits as Martin enters with some plaques._

speaker: Martin
text: You know the best thing about getting old?  Your hair may turn grey, your joints may stiffen, you may even have to walk with a cane.  But people still ask you to help them move!

speaker: Frasier
text: Forgive me for overburdening you, Dad.  Could you just put those in my office, please? _Martin angrily exits to Frasier's office as Daphne enters and notices the sign on the door.  It says "Niles Crane" and then in very small letters underneath it says "Frasier Crane."_

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, look at your two names together on the door.  Er, Dr. Crane, is your brother's name smaller than yours?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, that was the only way it would fit.  I assumed you wouldn't mind - after all, we're concerned here with healing people, aren't we?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, Niles.  If I were interested in self-promotion, I guess I'd be content with my radio show, heard every day by over half a million listeners - the Pacific Northwest and parts of Canada!

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm moving the Chepalire.

speaker: Frasier
text: I like it where it was.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but it didn't like it there.  It wants light.

speaker: Daphne
text: You two tend to your plant, I'll go fetch the file cabinet! [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I have had this plant for two years and it has never been in direct sunlight.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, obviously, look at it, the leaves are puckering!

speaker: Frasier
text: They are not, they've wilted a little from the ride over in the trunk of the car.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, nonsense, Mafia snitches emerge from car trunks looking more robust!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gets a hold on the plant_] This plant is going right over...

speaker: Martin
text: [_entering_] And so it begins!

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o_] Of course, the incident with the plant was only the beginning. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene One(g) - Therapist's Office. Niles tells the story._

speaker: Niles
text: That was followed by a run-in at the receptionist's desk, a row at the coffee machine, and a contretemps when Frasier lost the men room's key.

speaker: Frasier
text: That was an accident.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, it very nearly was.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am so tired of your exaggeration, you always make things fifteen thousand times worse than they are!  I'm going to tell the story from now on! _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Seven - Niles's Office. Frasier narrates over the scene.  Frasier and Niles are stood amongst a therapy group._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] The point is, our nerves were, well, pretty much shot by the time we conducted our first therapy group together...

speaker: Niles
text: First off, I have a colleague to introduce.  He is not only An esteemed psychiatrist, he happens to be my brother, Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Afternoon. Kedlish: Wow, you're Dr. Crane from the radio.

speaker: Frasier
text: Guilty as charged.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but we all have to remind Dr. Crane that this is real psychiatry now, not the radio.  No hanging up on the hard ones here!

speaker: Frasier
text: But rest assured I am trained to deal with a full range of issues.  Everything from envy to jealousy!  But, I'll just be observing today, I don't know you well enough to render any opinions yet, so just pretend I'm not here.

speaker: Niles
text: And good luck with that. [_approaches patient_] Mrs. Kalish, perhaps you could bring us up to date on how you're dealing with your divorce.  This is week two, isn't it?

speaker: Kalish
text: Yes.  Well, I actually had my first date last night.

speaker: Niles
text: That's wonderful.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmmm...

speaker: Kalish
text: Did you say something?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Kalish
text: It sounded like "Hmmm..." like you disapproved.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, since you've asked.  I think in divorce we have painful feelings, which are never the less healthy feelings. We start to date too quickly and we want to be sure that that's not panacea for the pain.

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, yes, you'll all find my brother's quite adept with those peppy little bromides; "panacea for the pain"!  You can almost hear the phrase: We'll be right back after these words from "Pringles"!

speaker: Carr
text: You don't want to wait too long before you date though, either.  I waited five years but then I was so desperate I stayed with the first woman who came along.  She ended up being the same controlling ice princess as my first wife.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmmm...

speaker: Niles
text: [_covering_] Well, Mr. Carr...

speaker: Carr
text: Wait, Dr. Crane, it sounded like your brother said something again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, since you've asked.  It occurred to me that by waiting for five and becoming, as you said, desperate, that perhaps you were really giving yourself license to pursue the woman who reminded you of your first wife.  You had to repeat the pattern.

speaker: Carr
text: So, you're saying that it wasn't an accident?

speaker: Frasier
text: We have an expression in psychiatry: "there are no accidents."

speaker: Niles
text: Now let's check in with news and traffic.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dr. Crane, are you denying that most accidents happen for a reason?

speaker: Niles
text: No, Dr. Crane, I believe they do.  I'm reminded of a recent "accident" involving a four-inch wooden block attached to a men's room key which walked off in somebody's pocket!  Clearly an act of hostility, wouldn't ya' say?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Certainly a well-deserved one, considering what an insufferable

speaker: Niles
text: You _dare_ call me a prig after I rescued you from that sideshow you call a radio program?

speaker: Frasier
text: One more crack about my show and I'll put that little wooden block in a place you'll always be able to find it!

speaker: Niles
text: [_fumes, then:_] Group, take five minutes of quiet introspection!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I have made a fist and I'm thinking of using it. [_holds it up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you are not scaring me... the thumb goes on the outside, Niles!  On the outside!

speaker: Niles
text: How dare you try to steal my group!

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't need your group!  I've got a group of my own, half a million strong!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yes, your legions!  Why don't you rent a farm, pass out the body paint and call it "Frasier-stock"!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm just a little tired of your condescending attitude.  You have not missed one single opportunity to run down my show or grab a book off the shelf to help me "get up to speed!"  My God, you're such a brilliant healer, you've even taken over the care of my Schefflera!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you were starving it of sunlight!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, fine, let's just give this little dear all the sunlight it needs! _Frasier picks it up and throws it out the window, breaking the glass as it goes._

speaker: Niles
text: Are you insane?!

speaker: Frasier
text: If I were, "Doctor," you'd never know it!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh...!  _Niles and Frasier carry on arguing whilst Niles's group, frightened, leave behind him._

speaker: Niles
text: Is that my group?  Group, group, come back, group! [_they exit and then:_] I'm very proud of this show of independence! [_shakes a fist, then:_] I hope you're happy!

speaker: Frasier
text: If I were, "Doctor," you'd never know it!

speaker: Niles
text: Stop saying that!

speaker: Schachter
text: Dr. Crane!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Dr. Schachter.

speaker: Schachter
text: What's going on?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm having a discussion with my brother.

speaker: Schachter
text: I could hear your discussion across the hall in my office.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you see, he waltzed in here like the belle of the ball and yet...

speaker: Schachter
text: Now, look, you two are obviously in some distress.  As you know, I am a specialist in couples therapy.  Now I've never treated brothers before, but still, if you step into my office, I'm sure I can help you.

speaker: Schachter
text: [_v.o_] Hold it!  Hold it! _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene One(h) - Therapist's Office. Dr. Schachter now breaks the story and finishes the flashback._

speaker: Schachter
text: I never said, "I'm sure I can help you."  I said, "I may be able to help you."

speaker: Niles
text: See how he twists your words?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_dangles men's room key_] Right here, buddy boy.

speaker: Schachter
text: Enough!  You are doctors!  I've never seen anything like this in my life. [_to Niles_] You think he's trying to steal your patients, [_to Frasier_] and you think he's trying to undermine you as a psychiatrist.  But you must know what is at the root of this problem.

speaker: Frasier/Niles
text: [_pointing_] He is!

speaker: Schachter
text: No.  You have a fundamental lack of trust.  Now it may be so deeply rooted by now that it's impossible to change but there are certain exercises that we try provided that you two are willing.  _They half-heartedly agree.  Schachter gets up and places a footstool in the center of the room._

speaker: Schachter
text: Let's start with the most basic trust exercise there is. Now, why don't you simply stand on this foot stool and fall backwards into your brother's waiting arms, thus demonstrating that we can trust each other. [_to Niles_] Dr. Crane, why don't you go first?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, all right.

speaker: Schachter
text: Just get up there, and let yourself go.

speaker: Niles
text: [_starts to fall and then_] Is he standing directly behind me?

speaker: Schachter
text: Yes, now trust your brother.

speaker: Niles
text: [_takes some time_] I'd feel better if he were wearing rubber soles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, Niles, just get down, I'll go first. All right?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_starts and then_] Is he in position?

speaker: Schachter
text: Yes!  Trust him!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes some time_] You should know he catches like a girl!

speaker: Schachter
text: I don't believe this.  Get down, will you? [_Frasier does_] This couldn't be easier! [_gets up_] I get up here, I count to three, and you catch me.  One, two, three. _However, Frasier and Niles have been too busy glaring distrustfully at each other to pay attention to him.  He falls backwards and sprawls onto the floor._

speaker: Frasier
text: Why didn't you catch him?!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you were closer!

speaker: Frasier
text: It was your turn!

speaker: Niles
text: "It was my turn"...!

speaker: Schachter
text: [_getting up_] That is it!  That is it!  In thirty years as a couples therapist, I've never said what I'm about to say: Give up!  It's hopeless!  You are pathologically mistrustful of each another, competitive to the point of madness! [_gets his coat_] So, trust me, just meet each other at weddings and funerals, and the rest of the time, stay the hell away from each other!  Now, I am going to limp to the nearest pub and drink until the rest of me is as numb as my ass!  _Schachter leaves, slamming the door behind him.  The brothers are dumbfounded for a moment._

speaker: Niles
text: Well... that's quite a diagnosis.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reads pad_] Yes.  But there is no denying it.  We are vindictive and competitive....

speaker: Niles
text: Petty, mistrustful...

speaker: Frasier
text: As so often in these cases it took someone outside our situation to point it out to us.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Dad always said it, but he has no credentials.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's no arguing with Dr. Schachter's credentials. [_motions to the diploma on the wall_] My God, the man is an expert in his field.  He graduated from the University of...

speaker: Frasier
text: Grenada!

speaker: Niles
text: [_shocked_] Well, surely that was just his undergraduate schooling.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, of course, his graduate work was done in... [_reads_] Aruba!

speaker: Niles
text: An all-Caribbean schooling... well, tally me banana!

speaker: Frasier
text: I knew he was a fraud the minute he opened his mouth.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs_] Oh, I'll have him out of his lease at the end of the week.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, we still have time to catch a late lunch!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, oh, "Peris" is just around the corner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Away we go.  Oh, "Chez Shea" is just as close.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes but the food at "Peris" is much better.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles. [_laughs_] Have you lost your mind?  _Frasier and Niles leave the office, still arguing about their choice of restaurant._
